dreisoft.tresos.autosar2.api.ecuresource

Interface IEcuResourceFinder

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultEcuResourceFinder

    public interface IEcuResourceFinder
    The ResourceFinder is used to find a EcuResourceProperties fitting to the current project. An EcuResourceFinder gets target, derivate, a pointer to the configuration (including preferences) of the current project and all registered resource properties and returns the resource properties that match the project. Resource properties are registered via the dreisoft.tresos.autosar2.api.plugin.ecuresource extension-point.

    Copyright (C) Elektrobit Automotive GmbH - All rights reserved

    Since:
    2008.a

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      EcuResourceProperties findProperties(DCtxt dCtxt, EcuResourceProperties[] resourceProperties)
      Checks if the given data model context matches one of the given resource properties.

    • Method Detail

      • findProperties

        EcuResourceProperties findProperties(DCtxt dCtxt,
                                     EcuResourceProperties[] resourceProperties)
        Checks if the given data model context matches one of the given resource properties. If it does, it will return this special entry. Otherwise this method returns null.
        Parameters:
        dCtxt - The data model context.
        resourceProperties - Array containing all ecu resource properties for a special target/derivate. This means that the array is filtered by target and derivate and each entry contains the same target value and the same derivate value. You can get the target and derivate by calling methods getTarget() and getDerivate() on any resource properties.
        Returns:
        Returns the resource properties entry from the given array that exactly matches the given data model context. If no entry matches the context it will return null.
        Since:
        2008.a
